text: Bacopa eisenii is a species of water hyssop known by the common name Gila River water hyssop. It is native to California and Nevada, where it grows in wet habitat such as rice paddies and muddy river banks. This aquatic plant has rounded or oval leaves 1 to 3 centimeters long with several longitudinal veins. The flower appears on a stout pedicel; it is white with a bright golden throat. The fruit is a capsule containing many seeds. ==External links== *Jepson Manual Treatment *Photo gallery Category:Plantaginaceae Category:Freshwater plants Category:Flora of California Category:Flora of Nevada
title: Bacopa eisenii
